alert.note: Alert for Pima; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:26PM MST until August 21 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Arizona and Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in South Central Arizona, Pima. In Southeast Arizona, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 315 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 PM MST, Moderate rainfall continues over areas hit earlier by heavy rain. At 9 PM MST Cienega Creek was up to 10.7 ft north of Sonoita. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cienega Creek, Fortynine Wash, Gardner Canyon, Mud Spring Canyon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Sonoita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
